alert.note: Alert for Marathon; Menominee; Portage; Shawano; Waupaca; Waushara; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 2:50AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE REGION WITH HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... .A strengthening low pressure system will track from the mid-Mississippi Valley to the central Great Lakes today into Saturday. The strong system will bring heavy snow and strong winds to the region. Most of the region should see between 7 to 15 inches of snow, with the highest amounts across northeast Wisconsin. In addition, wind gusts could reach around 50 mph in the Fox Valley and lakeshore areas where blizzard conditions are expected late Friday afternoon into Saturday morning. Temperatures near freezing could locally reduce snowfall totals right along the Lake Michigan shoreline today. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will create blowing and drifting snow and poor visibilities for motorists. * WHERE...Marathon, Portage, Waushara, Wood, Menominee, Shawano, and18 Waupaca Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Marathon; Menominee; Portage; Shawano; Waupaca; Waushara; Wood
